alert.note: Alert for Butler (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 19 at 4:59AM CDT until June 19 at 5:15AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN BUTLER COUNTY... At 459 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles west of Davenport to 7 miles south of Highland Home to 11 miles east of Georgiana, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe thunderstorms will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Butler County. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
